titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Alexander W. Burke collection FA754

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2015-10-26 15:54:12 -0400.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: When requesting to view films -- please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1902).
If the item does not have a designated AV number, please refer to the Title and the Film Number (which consists of a combination of Roman numerals and alphanumerics - example: III 14.1-6).

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: All inquires to view films require advanced notice of at least 24 hours, and may necessitate notice of up to one week. Individual items, including those that are not available in modern formats, may be restricted from scholarly access at the discretion of RAC.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Dr. Alexander W. Burke worked for the Rockefeller Foundation's International Health Division specifically in the yellow fever program during the 1920s-1930s. His work took him to different locations in Africa and South America.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection of travelogue, amateur home movie, and documentary films held at Rockefeller Archive Center come from Burke's work with the Rockefeller Foundation's yellow fever initiatives.

did.physdesc: Silent, Black and white, 11 minutes, Only available on original 16mm film. Condition is good (04/23/2015).
did.materialspec: Acetate film base, Kodak Safety Postive stock, Edgecode: 1932, 400 feet.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Scenes in Recife, Brazil; Catching mosquoito eating fish; pre-Lentan Carnival in Pernambuco, Brazil; air mail arriving from Washington D.C.; Pernambuco Brazil Yellow Fever Control Personnel; Tennis at British Country Club; Model T Ford and searching for mosquito larvae.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: All inquires to view films require advanced notice of at least 24 hours, and may necessitate notice of up to one week. Individual items, including those not available in modern formats, may be restricted from scholarly access at the discretion of RAC.

did.physdesc: Silent, Color, 11 minutes, Only available on original 16mm film. Condition is Okay, faded to red (04/23/2015).
did.materialspec: Acetate film base, Kodak Safety, Edgecode: 1935, 400 feet. Kodachrome was written on the cannister.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Travel footage of 1930s California and the Grand Canyon. American Indians in native costume dancing and children posing for the camera. A roadside attraction with a sign reading "Drink Again From the Fountain of Youth" is filmed. California city street scenes, beaches and a baseball game is captured.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: All inquires to view films require advanced notice of at least 24 hours, and may necessitate notice of up to one week. Individual items, including those not available in modern formats, may be restricted from scholarly access at the discretion of RAC.

did.physdesc: Silent, Black & white, 12 minutes, Only available on original 16mm film. Condition is okay. There is some warping and shrinkage (04/23/2015).
did.materialspec: Acetate film base, Kodak Safety, Edgecode: 1932, 436 feet.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Documentary film footage showing British Nigerian colonial troops practicing marching maneuvers, Nigerians interacting with British colonials in daily life, roadbuilding, crossing the Benye River into the French Cameroons, and Nigerians assemblying to donate for Yellow Fever Protection testing. It includes footage of Dr. Durand holding "Berberati" the Foundations mascot in equatorial Africa, the village chief of Delo, and the Sultan of Sokoto.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Travel footage of 1930s California and the Grand Canyon. American Indians in native costume dancing and children posing for the camera. A roadside attraction with a sign reading "Drink Again From the Fountain of Youth" is filmed. California city street scenes, beaches and a baseball game is captured.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Film documents scenes around Ibadan, Nigeria. The laboratory buildings of the Rockefeller Foundation in Lagos, Nigeria; street scenes in Lagos and people golfing and playing soccer.

did.physdesc: Silent, Black & white, 11 minutes, Only available on original 16mm film. Condition is poor. There are many splices. Do not project on Steenbeck (04/23/2015).
did.materialspec: Acetate film base, Kodak Safety, Edegcode: 1926, 400 feet. Written on the back of "How to use the Kodascope Humidor Can for re-moistening finished Cine-Kodak Film is a scene list; "AT JOHNS, AT JIMS, E.W. RYANS WEDDING, MARIE LOUISE, ONTWENTSIA, JIMMIE BURKE, DUBUQUE, MUNDELEIN"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: War dance of the CWARI TRIBE KUJAMA, ZARIA PROVINCE, NIGERIA, WEST AFRICA. Also captured on film is "Polo Practice in Nigeria", "Tennis in Lagos", "Polo game in Nigeria", and "Cricket at Ibadan, Nigeria"
